thread.title: Leicester and Leicestershire dole queues grow - Leicester Mercury

author: Tom Pegden
title: Leicester and Leicestershire dole queues grow - Leicester Mercury
text:
Leicester and Leicestershire dole queues grow The national jobless figure has also risen - by 115,000 to 8.8 million Share Get Business updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The number of jobless people in Leicester and Leicestershire has risen – as the national number of jobless rose 115,000 to 8.8 million. 
Official figures suggest the number of people on Job Seekers Allowance and Universal Credit in the city and county is 7,800 – marginally up on the previous month and 12 per cent up on this time last year. 
The new figures show an employment rate of 65.2 per cent in Leicester and 78 per cent in Leicestershire. 
The local figures showed the number of young claimants – aged 18-24 – stood at 1,650, showing a marginal increase on the previous month. 
The number of claimants aged 50 or older was also slightly up month-on-month at 2,065 as was the number of long term unemployed. Read More Jobless down due to strong Leicestershire economy 
Chris Hobson, director of policy at East Midlands Chamber of Commerce, said: “There are no real surprises in the figures released today. 
“We’ve known for some time that businesses were going to feel inflationary pressures and, when combined with the doubt and uncertainty over Brexit, would be less confident about recruitment.” Like us on Facebook
